DataElement.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Lower Extremity Functional Activity Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of lower extremity functional activity, using a six-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Musculoskeletal Tumor Society Rating Scale Lower Extremity Functional Activity Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities._The bottom one of two._A question about the functional activity of a person's extremity._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Concepts.definition: A physician-completed measure used to assess extremity function in patients undergoing surgery for musculoskeletal cancer. The scale scores for function and acceptance by 6 variables for upper extremities and 6 variables for lower extremities.

Property.preferredDefinition: The bottom one of two.:A question about the functional activity of a person's extremity.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about the functional activity of a person's extremity.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: MSTS Extremity Functional Activity Score 6 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 0 (Total disability) to 5 (No restrictions) on a Likert scale used on the Musculoskeletal Tumor Rating Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Total disability (restrictions cause major alterations in life-style or prevent patient from resuming his/her occupation)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Total disability (restrictions cause major alterations in life-style or prevent patient from resuming his/her occupation)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at a level of total disability: causing major alterations in life-style or preventing the person from resuming their occupation.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at a level of total disability: causing major alterations in life-style or preventing the person from resuming their occupation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Partial disability (includes restrictions that significantly affect the patient's life-style or produce partial occupational disability)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Partial disability (includes restrictions that significantly affect the patient's life-style or produce partial occupational disability)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at a level of partial disability: significantly affecting the person's life-style or producing partial occupational disability.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at a level of partial disability: significantly affecting the person's life-style or producing partial occupational disability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate - Between recreational restrictions only and partial disability

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate - Between recreational restrictions only and partial disability
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at an intermediate level between recreational restrictions only and partial disability.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at an intermediate level between recreational restrictions only and partial disability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Recreational restrictions only (do not seriously affect patient's life-style or occupation)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Recreational restrictions only (do not seriously affect patient's life-style or occupation)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are only recreational: do not seriously affect the person's life-style or occupation.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are only recreational: do not seriously affect the person's life-style or occupation.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Intermediate - Between no restrictions and recreational restrictions only

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Intermediate - Between no restrictions and recreational restrictions only
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at an intermediate level between no restrictions and recreational restrictions only.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that a person's functional extremity restrictions are at an intermediate level between no restrictions and recreational restrictions only.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating no restrictions for functional activity of the person's extremity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating no restrictions for functional activity of the person's extremity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
